roleset.name: motion in a new direction
roleset.note: TURNABOUT-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on turn-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls crane-40.3.2, hurt-40.8.3-1-1, meander-47.7, roll-51.3.1. (from turnabout.01-n)

example.name: light verb
example.text: ...The reason that she has buses-1 come *PRO*-1 to make a sharp turnabout at 2,400 meters above sea level just possibly is in order to leave you with a certain degree of difficulty...

roleset.name: transformation, becoming
roleset.note: TURNABOUT-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on turn-v.02. Corresponds to Vncls convert-26.6.2, turn-26.6.1. (from turnabout.02-n)

roles.note: Watch out for light verbs! Also, arg0 is being left off because it is not clear that it can occur in nominal usages. If you see one, call it arg0 and send it in. (from turnabout.02-n)

example.name: All arguments
example.text: ...her turnabout from not wanting to have anything to do with them to jumping into bed with one...
example.arg: from not wanting to have anything to do with them
to jumping into bed with one
